intro: Paepalanthus erigeron, commonly known as the white dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that resemble those of the common dandelion. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in regions with temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and hairy. Paepalanthus erigeron is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
